metadata.title: CVE-2020-11996 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: A specially crafted sequence of HTTP/2 requests sent to Apache Tomcat10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0-M5, 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.35 and 8.5.0 to 8.5.55 couldtrigger high CPU usage for several seconds. If a sufficient number of suchrequests were made on concurrent HTTP/2 connections, the server couldbecome unresponsive.

criterions.comment: tomcat9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tomcat8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
